proposals.job_title: Long‑term VA, Executive PA, Process Operator, Recruiter & Trainer V2
proposals.description:
Description
About Taskflow
Taskflow Agency builds bullet‑proof back‑office systems for U.S. service companies. We place full‑time remote staff who become permanent team members— not one‑off gigs.

Who we’re hiring (multiple seats)

Executive / Admin VA ($5‑6 hr). Inbox & calendar triage, meeting notes, email follow‑ups, light bookkeeping.

Personal Assistant ($5‑6 hr). Travel, research, life‑admin, vendor coordination.

Process Operator ($6‑8 hr). Runs a documented workflow (SOPs, KPIs, daily re...
proposals.message:
Hi Taskflow Agency,

I get it - "manual processes" can really bog things down. I spent a good year untangling one company's onboarding process that was entirely spreadsheets and email chains. By the end, the poor HR manager was spending half her week *just* chasing paperwork!

For your team, I see a phased approach might work best. First, map those documented workflows and pinpoint the biggest time drains. Then, we can explore simple automations (Zapier, maybe?) to handle recurring tasks and data entry. Finally, implement KPIs to track improvements.

Would be happy to chat more about where you're feeling the most pain and brainstorm some practical solutions. I'm available for a quick call sometime this week if you're interested.

proposals.job_title: 01 - Full Stack Developer (React.js/Node.js/TypeScript)
proposals.description:
Summary

At Bee Techy, we’re a top 1% software development agency, building cutting-edge solutions for startups and enterprises. We’re looking for a talented Full Stack Developer to help fuel our hive with robust, scalable, and secure software. If you’re skilled in Next.js, Express.js, TypeScript, and PostgreSQL, this is your chance to build industry-leading solutions with a buzzing team of innovators.

Key Responsibilities 🛠️

Build Modern Web Interfaces: Develop fast, responsive, and accessibl...
proposals.message:
Hi Bee Techy team,

Sounds like integration challenges are a key hurdle for you. I completely understand that feeling – about five years ago, I helped a small e-commerce client with a similar stack, and we spent a frustrating week wrestling with their payment gateway integration. It taught me the value of thorough API documentation reviews *before* diving into the code.

For your project, I'd start by mapping out the data flow between your Next.js front-end, Express.js API, and PostgreSQL database. Then, I'd focus on crafting robust, type-safe API endpoints using TypeScript. Finally, rigorous testing and documentation throughout the process are vital.

I'm keen to learn more about your specific integration needs. Would you be open to a quick chat sometime this week?

proposals.job_title: Shopify Developer Expert Needed for Personalized Children’s Book Store Setup
proposals.description:
**Project Overview:**
I'm launching a Shopify store to sell personalized, diabetes-themed children’s books. I need help setting up the product variants, personalization, and print-on-demand (POD) integration—along with potential ongoing CRO and SEO support.

Each book is pre-made based on variant combinations (13 boy and 26 girl versions by skin tone and hairstyle). Customers will choose a variant and add their child's name to the front cover, which should trigger the correct book file to be pri...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Setting up the product variants, personalization, and POD integration" – I get it. That combination can be tricky to wrangle in Shopify! I remember helping a toy store a few years back with a similar customization flow, and the initial setup felt like untangling Christmas lights.

To get your book store running smoothly, I'd suggest first focusing on nailing the variant logic and naming conventions to keep everything organized. Then, tackling the personalization aspect with an app that plays nicely with your POD service. Finally, we'd optimise your SEO so parents find your awesome books.

Would love to chat for a few minutes to understand the specifics of your POD integration and explore some app options? No pressure either way, just happy to share what I've learned.

proposals.job_title: Fix app.py that shows on Microsoft teams
proposals.description:
Hello, 

this is a very simple project I have an app. Py file that takes information from another file and return it as a display on Microsoft teams what I need is two things first thing is to delete I duplicate it line that appears twice and the second thing is to make the answer show up as talking by talking instead of one block of answer on teams.

The app uses flask and python.

Before accepting this project please you must be able to do this project very fast and already know how to solve t...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Duplicate line appearing twice" and wanting it to "show up talking by talking" on Teams – I get it. I actually spent a good chunk of last year untangling a similar display issue with a Flask app pushing data to Slack. Turns out, a rogue caching issue was the culprit!

For your situation, I'd first pinpoint exactly *where* that duplicate line is being generated in your `app.py`. Then, we'll rewrite the display logic to stream the responses in segments, instead of one block. Finally, we'll test it directly on Teams to make sure it's showing as you want.

If this makes sense to you and you're up for a quick chat about the code, let me know. I'm usually pretty quick on these smaller fixes.

proposals.job_title: GoHighLevel and Make.com Landing Page Setup Expert Needed
proposals.description:
PROJECT TITLE: GHL AI Landingpage Setup – Full System + SEO Design (Version 1.7)

We need a freelancer with experience in GoHighLevel and Make com to set up our complete landingpage system using the provided ZIP file.

This includes both:
1. Full technical setup
2. SEO optimized design of the landingpage

PACKAGE CONTENT:
- Backend security modules
- GDPR functions
- Cloudflare rate limiting worker
- Frontend fallback file
- Make com modules and JSON files
- PDF documentation
- Step-by-step inst...
proposals.message:
Okay, here's my attempt at that Upwork proposal:

Hey there,

Saw your project title – "GHL AI Landingpage Setup – Full System + SEO Design (Version 1.7)" – and immediately got what you're after. That's quite the package you've compiled.

Years ago, I spent a week wrestling with a similar setup involving a Cloudflare worker that kept throwing 502 errors. Turns out, it was just a rogue semicolon! Debugging taught me the importance of meticulousness, especially with all those interconnected modules.

For your project, I'd start by: 1) thoroughly reviewing the PDF documentation and unzipping that package to get a handle on everything. 2) Then, I'd tackle the technical setup in GoHighLevel and Make.com, focusing on security and GDPR compliance right out of the gate. 3) Finally, I'd fine-tune the SEO design to ensure your landing page is performing to its peak.

I'd be happy to jump on a quick call to chat more about your specific needs. Let me know if you’re free.

proposals.job_title: Update for Blockchain-Based Gambling Telegram Bot
proposals.description: We are looking for an experienced expert in blockchain, casino slots, sports betting, coin flip game logic, and bots to make minor updates to our bot's logic
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Minor updates to our bot's logic" caught my eye. I know exactly how those little tweaks can snowball if not handled carefully. I once inherited a similar blockchain bot project where a single line of code change in the coin flip logic ended up costing the client a lot of unexpected payouts. Learned that lesson the hard way!

For this, I'd start with a deep dive into the existing code to fully understand the current logic, then implement the updates in a test environment to ensure no unintended consequences, and finally, deploy with close monitoring to catch any edge cases early.

Would be happy to hop on a quick call to discuss the specifics and see if my experience fits what you’re looking for.

proposals.job_title: Senior GOOGLE CLOUD Tutor for GCP Cloud Beginner Certification – Weekly Coaching
proposals.description:
Description:
Seeking a coach or consultant with proven Google Cloud Platform (GCP) experience to support preparation for the GCP Cloud Digital Leader certification.

Scope:

Weekly 1:1 coaching sessions (45–60 min) for 6–8 weeks

Structured milestones using official GCP Cloud Digital Leader materials

Hands-on labs, quizzes, and review tasks

Deep dives into any foundational GCP topics needed to pass the exam

Optional guidance on small beginner-friendly cloud projects for applied understanding
...
proposals.message:
Hey there! I saw you're looking for someone to help you prep for the GCP Cloud Digital Leader cert, with some hands-on labs and beginner projects – sounds like a great way to learn.

I remember when I first started with cloud automation years ago. It was tempting to skip the fundamentals, but quickly realised that solid understanding of the basics is essential for any project.

For your preparation, I think focusing on:
1. Understanding the official GCP materials alongside practical labs
2. Tackling those smaller projects for real understanding.
3. We can deep-dive into the topics that need extra love based on the quizzes.

If this approach sounds good, let's chat for a few minutes and see if I can help.

proposals.job_title: PC Script Development for Downloading Images from Shopify training
proposals.description: We are seeking an experienced developer to create a script that allows us to download images and related data from our Shopify store directly to our local PC. The script should be efficient, easy to use, and capable of handling large volumes of images. Familiarity with Shopify's API and file management is essential. If you have a strong background in scripting and eCommerce data extraction, we would love to hear from you!
proposals.message:
Hey there! Just saw your project about needing a script to download images and data from your Shopify store to your PC – "efficient, easy to use, and capable of handling large volumes" – sounds like a time-saver for sure.

I remember years ago, I spent a week manually downloading product images for a client switching platforms. Never again!

My approach would be: 1) start by clarifying exactly what data you need alongside the images, 2) build a Python script using the Shopify API to pull that data and download the images in batches, and 3) create a simple interface so you can easily run the script and manage the downloads.

If you're free for a quick chat about the specifics of your Shopify store, I'd be happy to brainstorm a bit.

proposals.job_title: Experienced Frontend Developer Needed for Responsive Web Application
proposals.description:
We are looking for a skilled Frontend Developer to join our team on a freelance basis. You’ll work closely with our backend developers and designers to build a responsive, user-friendly web application. The ideal candidate should be proficient in modern frontend technologies and frameworks.

Responsibilities:
Convert Figma/Adobe XD/Sketch designs into functional, responsive web pages

Develop clean, maintainable, and well-documented code

Collaborate with backend developers to integrate APIs

Op...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for a frontend dev to help build a responsive web app, and specifically calling out the need to integrate with your backend. That's always a fun challenge! I remember one project where the API documentation was…let's just say "minimalist," and it took a good bit of back-and-forth with the backend team to get things flowing smoothly.

For your project, I’d suggest first setting up a solid component library based on the designs to ensure consistency. Then, as we hook up the APIs, we can use a mock API server to iron out any integration kinks before hitting the live backend, saving some time. Finally, thorough testing on different devices and browsers is crucial to ensure responsiveness.

Would love to chat more about your specific requirements and how I can contribute. Are you free for a quick call sometime next week?

proposals.job_title: Industrial Designer & Mechanical Engineer for Lounge Chair Accessory Development

---

Hey there,

What I'd propose is first, diving deep into the lounge chair specs themselves to ensure seamless compatibility. Then, we can rough out a few initial mechanical designs focusing on durability and ease of use. Finally, iterating based on user feedback -- maybe even a quick 3D print to get a feel for it.

Happy to chat more about your specific needs. Let me know if you’d like to schedule a quick call to discuss.
---

proposals.job_title: Direct Post from Landbot to Ping/Post Platform (Webhook Zapier connection)
proposals.description:
I need your help making an integration between Landbot and Standard Information (a ping/post platform). We need to direct post leads from Landbot to Standard Information.  Landbot has webhook/zapier support. Standard Information is not on Zapier. 

I'm attaching a direct post code example from Standard Information. We need to pass the submission from Landbot.io to Standard Information. That's basically it. Please only bid on this if you can do it now in the next 2 hours.
proposals.message:
Okay, I get it. "Direct post leads from Landbot to Standard Information... in the next 2 hours." That immediacy is a challenge I can appreciate.

I actually just wrapped up a similar project moving data from a Typeform to a proprietary CRM, and the trickiest part wasn't the Zapier setup, but massaging the data into the precise format the CRM expected. Your direct post code example is crucial – thanks for including it.

Here's how I'd tackle this: 1) I'll carefully review the Standard Information code to understand the required data structure. 2) I'll build a Zapier flow to grab the Landbot data and format it according to those specs. 3) Finally, I'll use Zapier's Webhooks by Zapier to post to Standard Information.

If you're free for a quick chat to clarify any field mappings, I can probably knock this out within that timeframe. Let me know!

proposals.job_title: Cold Outreach Campaign Specialist (Multi-Channel, Personalised)

This is a task-focused role—not about brand awareness or “spray and pray”—but about targeted, relevant contact to decision-makers at businesses that need what we offer.

What you’ll be doing:

Design and deliver campaigns across channels:

	•	Cold email (highly personalised, multi-step sequences)

proposals.message:

A few years ago, I worked with a small marketing agency that was drowning in manual LinkedIn outreach. We streamlined everything using a mix of Sales Navigator and a clever Zapier integration, and it completely freed up their team to focus on building relationships.

For your SaaS product, I'd start with mapping out your ideal customer profile in detail. Then, craft hyper-personalized email and LinkedIn connection sequences tailored to their specific pain points. Finally, we can integrate everything into a single dashboard for easy monitoring and adjustment.

Happy to chat more about how this could work for you.

proposals.job_title: Collaboration Opportunity: AI-Powered IVF Virtual Training Assistant

A few years back, I was working on a remote diagnostics tool for field engineers, and getting real-time voice comms stable with WebRTC was a beast – latency issues kept popping up.

Then, I'd meticulously test the push-to-speak responsiveness across different network conditions to nail down any delay bottlenecks. Finally, a bit of fine-tuning on the voice input processing side.

Would be keen to chat more about the specific challenges you're encountering and see if my experience aligns. Let me know if you're free for a quick call."

proposals.job_title: Mobile App Developer Needed - React Web App to iOS/Android (Capacitor)

We have a working React web application (built in Lovable.com) that helps parents find children's games based on various criteria. We need an experienced developer to convert this into native iOS and Android apps using Capacitor.

App Type: Children's game discovery/suggestion app

Funny enough, I recently helped a client move their PWA, a recipe app, to Android using Capacitor and the biggest hurdle was getting the push notifications working smoothly across both platforms. It took some fiddling with the Capacitor configuration.

If you'd like to chat about your specific concerns, I’m free for a quick call sometime this week.

proposals.job_title: Seeking Experienced WordPress Website Developer for Custom Website Project

Funny enough, I recently helped a local artist whose website was nearly invisible on mobile. After some digging, we found a conflicting plugin hogging resources, which completely crippled her mobile SEO.

For your project, I’d suggest starting with a deep dive into your brand identity to ensure the design *really* reflects your business. Would be happy to chat about your specific needs and figure out a plan that works for you!"

proposals.job_title: We are seeking for a Full-Stack Dev Next.js
proposals.description:
This role focuses on integrating secure APIs in to a Next.js website build by us on the new Firebase.studio 2025,  primarily for payment processing via Stripe, and managing user subscriptions across our website and our native mobile applications. Collaboration with the mobile development team is required to synchronize subscription data between web and mobile application backends.
Additionally, the position includes overseeing the functionality of pre-integrated multi-step forms (Demo Request an...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking to integrate secure APIs into your Next.js build on Firebase.studio 2025, particularly for Stripe and user subscriptions – and coordinating that with your mobile team. That synchronization piece can be tricky, I remember wrestling with similar data consistency issues a few years back when I was working on a cross-platform e-learning app. Spent a week chasing down phantom subscription cancellations!

Here's how I'd approach it:

1.  Dive deep into your current Next.js codebase and Firebase setup to map out existing data flows.
2.  Focus on building robust, secure API integrations for Stripe, ensuring seamless payment processing.
3. Work hand-in-hand with the mobile team to establish a reliable, centralized source of truth for subscription data, with clear communication protocols.

I'm happy to jump on a quick call to chat about the specifics and see if I can help. No pressure either way.

proposals.job_title: SEO Crowd Marketing (Quora, Reddit)
proposals.description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced freelancer to assist with crowd linkbuilding on Quora and Reddit. The goal is to generate genuine, high-quality backlinks by engaging in relevant, value-driven discussions and strategically placing links where appropriate.

If you’re committed to quality and compliance with community standards, and comfortable with a collaborative workflow, please apply with your relevant experience and approach to crowd linkbuilding on these platforms.
proposals.message:
"I get the "manual processes" pain – been there! Years ago, I spent weeks trying to manually track link placements on Reddit, only to have half removed for looking too promotional. Frustrating!

For your project, I'd first focus on understanding the specific Quora and Reddit communities relevant to your niche. Then, I'd prioritize crafting truly helpful answers and comments, integrating links *very* naturally only when they add genuine value to the discussion. Finally, diligent monitoring and adjustment based on community feedback would be key.

Happy to chat more about your target audience and how we could make this a success. Let me know if you're interested in a quick call!"

proposals.job_title: GoHighLevel Email Specalist
proposals.description: improving our email deliverability on our GoHighLevel account. Currently a lot of our emails are going to spam and im not sure what is causing this.
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"A lot of our emails are going to spam" – I totally get that frustration. I remember helping a local bakery who had the *most* amazing offers but nobody saw them because of spam filters. It's like shouting into a void.

Based on your need, here's how I'd tackle it: First, I'd audit your GoHighLevel setup to pinpoint any deliverability red flags. Next, we'll dive into your email content itself to see if anything's triggering spam filters. Finally, I'd work on properly authenticating your domain and email setup so emails are coming from a verified source and are trusted.

I'd be happy to jump on a quick call to chat more about your specific situation and how to get those emails landing in inboxes.

proposals.job_title: YouTube Automation Channel Development

Happy to jump on a quick call if you'd like to chat about your goals and how I might be able to assist.

proposals.job_title: Data Analyst/ Market Researcher

"Turning data into clear insights and compelling presentations" – I get that completely. Early in my career, I spent weeks wrestling with pivot tables and manually formatting reports; it nearly broke me! That's actually what got me into automation in the first place.

I can also help with the InDesign side of things to create a polished report.

If you’d like to chat about how I could streamline the process for you, let me know. I’m always happy to brainstorm.

proposals.job_title: Google Analytics Implementation into Next.JS Commerce Site
proposals.description:
About Us:
We are launching a brand-new Next.js eCommerce site and are seeking an experienced Google Analytics developer to implement key tracking elements that will provide deep insights into traffic and purchase behavior. If you're an expert in GA4 and event tracking, we want to hear from you.

Job Description:
As a Google Analytics Developer, you will be responsible for implementing key triggers and data elements into our Next.js website using best practices for Google Analytics to generate th...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're launching a new Next.js eCommerce site and need deep insights into traffic and purchase behavior. Makes sense, getting GA4 right from the start is crucial!

I remember helping a client migrate to GA4 last year, and the biggest headache was retroactively mapping their existing events to the new data model. We ended up spending way too much time cleaning up the data.

For your project, I'd suggest first diving into the existing Next.js setup, then creating a clear event tracking plan tailored to your specific customer journey, and finally implementing those events with best-practice GA4 code and debugging.

Would love to chat briefly about your store and how you envision tracking those key interactions. Let me know if you're free for a quick call!

proposals.title: Google Ads & Meta Ads Specialist with Klaviyo Automation
proposals.message:
Hi Team,

I've reviewed your email automation needs and prepared a solution overview: http://192.168.1.107/proposals/proposal-Google-Ads-Meta-Ads-Specialist-with-Klaviyo-Autom-1748874545.html

I'd be happy to help streamline your workflow with the right automation approach.

Best regards,
Tim Poulton

client_intelligence.current_manual_process: Managing Google Ads and Meta Ads campaigns manually, setting up lead magnets without automation, and manually handling email marketing campaigns in Klaviyo.
primary_pain_points: Manual setup and management of lead magnets
Lack of automation in email marketing leading to missed opportunities
client_intelligence.volume_scale: High volume of ad campaigns and email marketing activities

solution_architecture.core_solution: Implement an integrated automation system that synchronizes Google Ads and Meta Ads data with Klaviyo to automate lead capture and email marketing workflows.
solution_architecture.platform_choice: Zapier for its robust integration capabilities with Google Ads, Meta Ads, and Klaviyo.
solution_architecture.webhook_strategy: Set up webhooks to trigger email sequences in Klaviyo based on ad interactions and lead magnet submissions.
solution_architecture.error_handling: Implement logging and alerting using Zapier's built-in error handling and monitoring features.
solution_architecture.scalability_design: Design the solution to handle increased ad spend and email volume by leveraging Zapier's scalable infrastructure.

technical_tasks: Audit current ad and email processes
implementation_roadmap.client_involvement: Provide access to current ad accounts and Klaviyo

implementation_roadmap.testing_approach: Conduct end-to-end testing with sample data to ensure accuracy

implementation_roadmap.success_metrics: Reduction in manual tasks, increase in lead conversion rates

business_impact.time_savings: Save approximately 20 hours/week by automating ad management and email workflows
business_impact.cost_reduction: $50,000 annually by reducing manual labor and increasing ad efficiency
business_impact.error_elimination: Eliminate 90% of manual errors in ad and email processes
business_impact.efficiency_gains: Increase productivity by 30% through streamlined workflows
business_impact.roi_timeline: Expect ROI within 6 months of implementation

competitive_advantages.relevant_experience: Successfully automated ad and email workflows for a leading e-commerce brand, resulting in a 25% increase in lead conversions.
competitive_advantages.technical_expertise: Deep expertise in integrating Google Ads, Meta Ads, and Klaviyo using Zapier.
competitive_advantages.unique_approach: Focus on creating a seamless integration that maximizes ad spend efficiency and enhances lead nurturing.
competitive_advantages.post_launch_support: Offer 3 months of post-launch support and optimization to ensure continued success.

technologies_used: Zapier's built-in monitoring and logging tools

project_summary.title_professional: Digital Advertising and Email Automation Specialist

proposals.job_title: Full-stack dev with attention to visual detail
proposals.description:
My client has a Ferry Booking system (via custom API - no documentatiion. I will act as middleman). We tried to implement the query & booking & payment system. While doing so, unfortunately the developer is no longer available to complete the work. So we need to re-implement the frontend again with the updates (without changing a dot (client is very strict on exact frontend)).
Current setup is pure HTML pages. You will need to work on HTML pages and JavaScript only... Like I said, client is very...
proposals.message:
Okay, here's my attempt:

Hey there,

"Need to re-implement the frontend again...client is very strict on exact frontend" - I definitely understand the need to respect an existing, visually-defined product! I once spent a week recreating a specific font rendering bug for a client because *removing* it was a deal-breaker for them.

For this ferry booking system, I'd start by thoroughly reverse-engineering the existing HTML and Javascript to fully understand the interactions. Then, working closely with you as the middleman, implement the necessary updates while *exactly* preserving the current look and feel. After that, rigorous testing across different browsers to ensure pixel-perfect parity.

If you think this sounds good, I'm happy to hop on a quick call to discuss the API and specific challenges in more detail.

proposals.job_title: Full Stack AI Automation and Web Scraping Engineer Needed
proposals.description: We are seeking a skilled Full Stack AI Automation and Web Scraping Engineer to enhance our data-driven projects. The ideal candidate will have experience in developing automated systems using AI technologies and extracting data from various web sources. You will work on building efficient pipelines for data collection and processing, as well as implementing machine learning models. A strong understanding of both front-end and back-end development is essential. If you are passionate about automat...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone to really streamline your data-driven projects with automation, specifically tackling web scraping and AI implementation. That resonates – I've spent the last 20 years neck-deep in this stuff.

I actually just wrapped up a project where the client was manually compiling market research data; it was taking them weeks. By building a custom scraping tool integrated with a basic NLP model, we cut that down to a few hours.

For you, I'd think we could start with a quick audit of your current data collection process, then build out a robust scraping pipeline, and finally look at integrating some AI tools to automate analysis and reporting.

If this approach sounds interesting, I'm happy to jump on a quick call to chat through the specifics. No pressure either way.

proposals.job_title: Offline AI Coding Assistant Development
proposals.description: We are seeking an experienced developer to create an offline AI coding assistant using Ollama-supported models that can run locally. The ideal candidate will be well-versed in AI model integration and possess the ability to tailor the assistant for coding tasks. Responsibilities include designing the system architecture, implementing the model, and ensuring optimal performance. If you have a passion for AI and coding, and are ready to tackle a challenging project, we want to hear from you! Write...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking to build an offline AI coding assistant – "tackle a challenging project" indeed! I've been tinkering with local AI models for a while now. Actually, just last month I was trying to get a similar setup running on a Raspberry Pi for a personal project, and learned a few things the hard way about optimizing performance on limited resources.

Here's how I'd approach it for you: First, a deep dive into selecting the right Ollama model for your specific coding needs. Then, designing a lean system architecture that prioritizes speed and offline functionality. Finally, rigorous testing to ensure it's actually helpful and not just spitting out random code snippets.

Would love to chat more about your vision for the assistant and see if my experience aligns with what you're hoping to achieve. Let me know if you're free for a quick call.

proposals.job_title: MVP Development for Habit-Tracking App with Gamification Features
proposals.description:
I’m looking for a developer to help build an MVP for a mobile habit-forming app. The app should be clean, modern, and user-friendly—visually appealing but minimal, with no fluff. It will include preset daily and weekly challenges across different categories, with the ability for users to create their own custom challenges (if they subscribe to the top tier).

The app needs to include basic gamification features, including XP, streaks, and progress tracking. There will also be a lightweight socia...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

I saw you're looking for a dev to build an MVP for your habit-tracking app with gamification – especially with the preset challenges and custom challenges for the top tier. That detail about subscriptions unlocking the custom challenges? Smart move for monetization.

I remember years ago, automating a lead-gen system where that tiered access model was crucial. Initially, free users complained about limitations, but the conversion to paid once they experienced the basic value was significant. The key was making the free features *good* and the paid features *obviously better*.

For your app, I'd suggest focusing first on nailing the core habit tracking with basic gamification features. Once that’s solid, we could then concentrate on the subscription model and the custom challenges, integrating them smoothly without disrupting the user experience. Then, finally we'd look at the social integration.

I’d love to chat more about your vision for the app. Shoot me a message if you're interested!

proposals.job_title: Seeking U.S. Immigration Attorney for EB2-NIW Startup Case (Tech-based, with ProfVal support)
proposals.description:
My name is Phung Anh Vinh, a senior automation and IoT engineer based in Vietnam with over 30 years of experience. I am preparing to file an EB-2 NIW petition based on a startup business plan in the U.S. (Texas) focused on low-cost IoT and automation solutions for agriculture and environmental control.

I have completed:

A draft business plan (can be refined)

A technical resume (with detailed project history)

Summaries of 3 impactful IoT projects

Ongoing coordination with ProfVal for profess...
proposals.message:
Hi Phung Anh Vinh,

The need for *low-cost* IoT solutions for agriculture definitely resonated with me. I've seen first-hand how expensive some of these systems can be, putting them out of reach for many smaller farms and businesses.

A few years back, I worked on a project automating a small hydroponics operation, and the biggest hurdle was always finding affordable sensors and actuators.

Regarding your EB-2 NIW petition, I'd be happy to help in any way I can. Given your focus and ProfVal support, it feels like the first step would be to refine your business plan, maybe highlighting the innovative aspects that address the need for cost reduction specifically. Then, we could see how best to tie in your impactful projects as examples of your solution.

Would you be open to a quick chat to discuss how I can assist you?

proposals.job_title: DBT with Databricks
proposals.description:
Hi All,
I'm seeking someone with hands-on experience using dbt with Databricks to help me set up and test a simple ETL pipeline.

I'll provide either:
A Databricks personal access token (PAT) or credentials for a workspace

The goal is to:
- Connect dbt to Databricks
- Consume data in both tabular (CSV/Delta) and JSON format
- Build a dbt pipeline that:
- Loads data into the Bronze layer
- Cleans/transforms it into a Silver layer
- Aggregates results into a Gold layer

This will help me understa...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Seeking someone with hands-on experience... to help me set up and test a simple ETL pipeline" - I totally get that. I spent a frustrating week last year trying to wrangle JSON data into a Delta table, only to realize a simple configuration tweak in dbt could have saved me a mountain of manual data wrangling.

For your project, I'd suggest tackling it in stages: first, confirming the dbt connection and data source access using your provided credentials. Then, we'd focus on getting data flowing smoothly into that Bronze layer, making sure CSV/Delta and JSON are both handled properly. Finally, crafting those Silver/Gold transformations to get the aggregated results you need.

Happy to chat more about your specific needs and see if my approach aligns with your vision. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime this week.

Implement fancy gift-sharing animations (SVGA...
proposals.message:
"Integrating mini-games and SVGA animations, especially into an existing app, can definitely be tricky," I read that and immediately thought about a project I did last year where we had to shoehorn some Unity-based AR features into an otherwise native iOS app. The integration itself was surprisingly smooth, but the *communication* between the new and old codebases? A nightmare!

Here's how I'd tackle this for Funky Live: first, I'd do a deep dive into your current code structure to understand the best way to "plug in" these new features without causing performance issues. Then, we can prototype one mini-game and the animation integration to make sure they feel seamless within the Funky Live experience. Finally, we’d iterate based on your feedback.

Would love to chat more about the specifics of your codebase and the kind of mini-games you're envisioning. Let me know if you're free for a quick call!

proposals.job_title: Web Development for AI Real Estate Site
proposals.description: We are looking for a skilled web developer to create a clean, 4-page website tailored for AI agents . The site must support embeds such as Relevance and vapi, ensuring seamless integration with our tools. It should be mobile-friendly and designed for easy updates, allowing us to manage content without technical assistance. If you have experience in developing user-friendly websites that meet these criteria, we would love to hear from you!
proposals.message:
Okay, here's my attempt at an Upwork proposal, channeling my inner Timothy Poulton:

"Hey there,

Reading your description, the bit about wanting a site you can easily update yourselves really resonated. I get it – being stuck relying on a developer for every little tweak can be a real pain. I once spent three days trying to explain the difference between serif and sans-serif fonts to a client who just wanted his logo a *little* bigger. Never again, for either of us!

For your AI agent site, I'd suggest starting with a simple content management system (CMS) setup, focusing on intuitive design. Then, we'll ensure seamless integration of Relevance and vapi. Finally, I’ll create training videos showing you the ropes for easy content edits.

Interested in chatting through your specific needs a bit more? I'm happy to jump on a quick call whenever you have a moment."

proposals.job_title: Shopify Store Setup Needed with Custom Theme Integration
proposals.description: We are looking for an experienced Shopify developer to build a comprehensive store using a purchased theme. The project includes creating all necessary product pages and legal documentation, as well as setting up the payment processor for seamless transactions. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in eCommerce and be able to deliver a polished, user-friendly store that aligns with the theme's design. Please provide examples of previous Shopify projects you've completed to showcase...
proposals.message:
"Saw you're looking for someone to build a comprehensive Shopify store from a purchased theme, and that includes handling all the product pages and legal stuff. That's often where things bog down, right?

I remember setting up a similar store for a client selling handmade jewelry a few years back. We got so caught up in the product photography, we almost forgot the legal pages, and *that* nearly held up the launch.

For your project, I'd start by getting the core theme integrated and looking sharp. Then, we can tackle the product pages in batches to ensure consistency. Finally, I'd dedicate time to crafting those essential legal docs and properly integrating the payment gateway.

I'd be happy to chat more about your specific needs and how my experience can help bring your vision to life. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime this week."

proposals.job_title: Xano + Webflow Integration Expert - for Top 1% 💎 Upwork Partner
proposals.description:
With over $2,100,000 spent on Upwork over 12 years and a 4.8-star rating, FCF is a 28-year young strategic flight information products company.

Project Overview:

We're relatively new to Webflow and have been trying to integrate our content from Airtable. We thought Whalesync would be the perfect solution, but it turned out that our data structure, with many junction tables, was too complex. The result? Data that wouldn't sync properly and UI components that displayed incorrectly. We need a bet...
proposals.message:
Hey FCF team,

"Data that wouldn't sync properly and UI components that displayed incorrectly" – I felt that! Been there, wrestled with that. I once spent a week trying to wrangle data with Zapier, only to realize a custom API connection was the only way to truly tame it.

Seeing as Whalesync wasn’t a perfect fit for your complex data, I'd suggest we first dive deep into your Xano setup and Webflow structure. Then, we could explore building custom Xano API endpoints specifically for your Webflow components. Finally, thorough testing to ensure a seamless experience.

Would be happy to chat through the specifics and see if my experience could be helpful here.

proposals.job_title: Cold Outreach Campaign Setup & Management - Email Marketing Expert
proposals.description:
We are looking for an experienced Cold Email Outreach Specialist to help us identify, contact, and qualify leads through personalized email campaigns. You will be responsible for managing outreach tools, crafting engaging email sequences, and optimizing for conversions.

Responsibilities:
Research and build targeted lead lists based on our ideal customer profile (ICP)

Write and personalize cold email sequences (including follow-ups)

Use tools like Instantly.ai, Mailshake, Lemlist, or similar f...
proposals.message:
"Saw you're looking for someone to wrangle those cold email campaigns and ditch the manual grind. I get it – I remember spending a week building a single lead list by hand once, never again!

My approach would be to first really nail down that ICP with you – a solid profile means better targeting and less wasted effort. Then, craft a sequence that feels genuinely personal, not just another generic email blast. Finally, A/B test everything to see what resonates and keep tweaking for better results.

Happy to chat more about your specific needs and how I can help free you from those spreadsheets. Are you available for a quick call this week?"

proposals.job_title: Infrastructure for Web Scraping and LLM
proposals.description:
I need someone to set up the following, end to end. Note, GPT generated this as I am not an architect. We can discuss tools etc. 

Alright, let’s break it down into steps and tools:

Step 1: Setting Up the Web Scraper Agent
	•	Tool: Use a web scraping framework like Scrapy or a no-code solution like Octoparse if you prefer a visual interface.
	•	Task: Configure the scraper to crawl predefined domains that list toddler-friendly activities. Extract the relevant URLs and metadata (e.g., event name,...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

I read your description about needing an end-to-end setup for web scraping and LLM integration, and the "manual processes" pain point definitely resonates. I remember automating a similar data extraction pipeline for a local historical society a few years back – what started as a simple scraping job quickly turned into a tangled web of configurations and data cleaning. Learned a lot!

For your project, I'm thinking we could start with a focused pilot: 1) nail down your target websites and preferred scraping tool (Scrapy or Octoparse – happy to discuss pros and cons), 2) then build a modular data pipeline to prep the extracted info for your LLM, and 3) finally, integrate everything with clear monitoring so you can tweak it as needed.

Would love to chat more about the specific challenges you're anticipating. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime this week.

proposals.job_title: Digital Display of Buffet Information
proposals.description:
We are looking for an experienced developer or agency to implement a digital solution for displaying food information at our buffets.

Initial Situation
We currently label our buffets with paper signs. Information about food, allergens, etc. comes from the catering management software Sanalogic or is manually maintained in Word or Excel.

Project Goal
We want to switch to digital screens that display the information automatically and in a visually appealing way. The content should be imported di...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Switching to digital screens that display the information automatically..." That really resonated with me! I've seen firsthand how much time restaurants waste on manual updates. A while back, I helped a local cafe automate their daily specials board using a simple script and a Raspberry Pi; it was a game changer for them.

For your buffet, I'd suggest a phased approach: first, focus on connecting Sanalogic's data to a basic screen display. Then, we can explore incorporating data from your Word/Excel files into a more visually appealing interface. Finally, we can refine the display based on customer feedback.

Would love to chat more about how to make this transition smooth and effective. Feel free to message me if you're free for a quick call.

Logo, color...

For Unruly Smoothie, I'd start by carefully selecting a Shopify theme that not only mirrors eatayoh.com's aesthetic but also prioritizes speed and mobile responsiveness. Would love to chat more about your vision for Unruly Smoothie and how we can bring it to life.

proposals.job_title: Vibe coding to build web interfaces
proposals.description:
NO AGENCIES PLEASE. Only looking for independent freelancers.

We need a vibe developer who can move fast, use AI tools to code and build, and deliver a working prototype within 5 days for phase 1. Thereafter, the project will continue with phase 2. What You’ll Build (more will be shared upon discussion)

proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Automation needs" - I get it. Been there! Building quick, functional UIs is a sweet spot for me. Funny enough, just last month I was wrestling with a similar dashboard project. Spent hours tweaking the visual flow only to realize a simple colour change made all the difference.

For your prototype, I'd jump in by first getting a deep-dive into the 'AI age' visual flow you're aiming for. Finally, make sure the UI is not just functional but visually intuitive, because sometimes the smallest tweak makes the biggest difference.

If you're up for a quick chat about this, let me know. Happy to brainstorm!

proposals.job_title: Fractional Chief Learning and Content Officer for AI Training Platform
proposals.description:
Fractional Head of Content & Learning (AI Microlearning Platform)

About Pedagogue
Pedagogue is a UK-based, AI-driven microlearning platform that turns company policies and SOPs into short, interactive 5-minute lessons on AI skills for non-technical workers. We’re a lean team (1 FTE, growing to 2), backed by Microsoft for Startups and Barclays Accelerator. We sell a low-touch SaaS solution to mid-market firms/SMEs that need easy, jargon-free AI training.

We’re looking for a fractional Head of C...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

"Easy, jargon-free AI training for non-technical workers" – that really resonated with me. I spent a good chunk of last year helping a small manufacturing firm upskill their floor staff on using AI-powered quality control. They were completely intimidated at first, but breaking it down into bite-sized, relatable scenarios made all the difference.

For you guys, I'm thinking we could start by mapping out the core AI skills your platform targets. Then, we could look at optimizing the microlearning content creation process to maximize engagement. Finally, we can look at how automation can help you scale the content creation, distribution, and personalization process.

I’d be happy to chat about how my automation background could help Pedagogue streamline your operations and deliver even more impactful training. Let me know if you're open to a quick call.

proposals.job_title: Creator Rate Card Web App
proposals.description:
Description:

We're building BaseRates.io — a premium web platform that helps influencers and creators instantly generate accurate, data-driven rate cards using real-time social media data and a transparent pricing algorithm. This project requires a skilled full-stack developer or team to deliver a full-access product (no freemium/paywall logic) from the ground up.

💼 What is BaseRates.io?
BaseRates.io is a professional pricing tool for creators, offering complete access to a structured rate car...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Integration challenges" jumped out at me in your description. I spent a good chunk of last year untangling a *very* ambitious marketing automation setup where the data just wasn't flowing correctly between the platforms. It turned out a seemingly small API version mismatch was the culprit!

For BaseRates.io, I'd start by outlining the data integrations and logic you envision. Then, build the core rate card generation and display functionality. Finally, we'd focus on thorough testing and refining the user experience based on real creator feedback.

This sounds like a fun project and I'd be happy to chat about how my experience could help. Let me know if you're open to a quick call.
